pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Biological Resources Division, Northern Prairie Wildlife Research Center

descript.abstract: The bibliography provides 1,320 citations pertinent to Lesser Scaup (Aythya affinis) and covers a wide variety of sources. Citations included range from scientific articles specific to lesser scaup to fauna guides and other general sources. Key words (in italics) follow each citation to allow more specific information on each citation and more thorough searches for information of interest; also noted in the key words is whether greater scaup (Aythya marila) is included or if the citation combines greater and lesser scaup as "scaup."
descript.purpose: Information provided pertinent to Lesser Scaup (Aythya affinis).

spdom.descgeog: North America, including Yukon, Northwest Territories, Alaska, conterminous U.S. States.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, Northern Prairie Wildlife Research Center

dataqual.complete: Bibliography provides a wide variety of sources, including unpublished and gray literature. Noted in the key words is whether greater scaup (Aythya marila) is included or if the citation combines greater and lesser scaup as "scaup." Those citations that have been checked for accuracy against the original are preceded by an asterisk.

procstep.procdesc: The author is interested in updating this bibliography. Additional references or corrections to current listings can be sent to Dr. Austin.

overview.eaover: Entity - Lesser Scaup; Associated attributes - bibliography

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
